document_data.caption: The Captive's remains embedded into the stone of the Spirit Vault.
document_data.name: The Captive
document_data.mainbody:
'''The Captive''' was an ancient, unknown being that was imprisoned within the [[Spirit Vault]], a specialized structure built by the [[dwarves of the Domain]] within their [[The Domain|underground city]]. As of the [[Era of Upheaval]], it existed as a fossilized skeleton set into the stone walls of an underground chamber.
{{Quote|Those are the bones of a god.|[[Zo]], chieftain of the Domain.}}
document_data.Description:
{{Quote|That's not a god. That's just some monster.|[[Verran]], the [[warlock]].}}
While the exact physical appearance of the Captive was not known, its skeletal remains were very well preserved. The creature stood about the height of four [[human|men]], or twice the size of a [[giant]]. It was vaguely humanoid in appearance, with a skull that resembled that of a large feline, and distinct wings that extended out from its back.

The bones of the Captive did not appear like those from other creatures, but were veined with different colors ranging from light blue, to beige, to a coppery hue.

The Captive remained chained to the walls of the Spirit Vault with massive, magically enhanced [[chain]]s.
document_data.Abilities: While it was unknown exactly what powers the Captive held in life, [[blood of the Captive|its blood]] was an extremely powerful substance, A single vial of that blood was known to exist, preserved beneath the eternal flames of the Spirit Vault.
document_data.Possessions: The [[artifact]] known as ''[[the Torque]]''―which granted powerful magical protection to the wearer―was made from a single broken chain that bound the Captive to the Spirit Vault. It was said to grant its bearer the endurance, if not the might, of the Captive.
document_data.Relationships: The [[dwarves]] of [[Chult]] venerated the Captive as some sort of god.
document_data.History:
{{Quote|I had the worst dream. I was in chains... I was in chains, and there was an army of serpents.|[[Kitto]], describing the dream in which he had the role of the Captive.}}
The only recorded information about the Captive's life came from mosaics that decorated the serpentfolk city of [[Hisari]]. The Captive's final moments were spent fighting a massive army that comprised thousands of [[yuan-ti]]. In the battle, the Captive still bore the chains that it wore in death, but appeared to have broken away from confinement.

It was believed by the dwarves of the Domain that the Captive was imprisoned by the [[sarrukh]]. Both the sarrukh and their progeny, the yuan-ti, referred to ''the Torque'' as "the Atrocity", were incapable of utilizing its power, and actively sought to destroy the artifact.

As of the late 15{{th}} century DR, both the yuan-ti and others sought out the blood of the Captive, in order to bring the being back to life and take control of its will.
